title: Zelenskyy to address Congress as House Republicans grow skeptical about more aid
description: The timing of Zelenskyy's dramatic visit to Washington comes as the incoming House GOP majority's reluctance to approve more big money for Ukraine mounts.

title: Hunter Biden retains top defense lawyer ahead of expected GOP probes
description: Ahead of an expected deluge of GOP probes, President Joe Biden's son Hunter has retained high-powered defense lawyer Abbe Lowell to help navigate congressional oversight.

title: Alaskans use vehicles to light up dark runway so medevac flight can land
description: Residents of a small Alaskan town used their vehicles to light up a dark airstrip to help a medevac plane land to pick up a patient on Sunday.

title: Israel's Netanyahu says he has formed new government
description: Designated Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says he has successfully formed a new coalition to govern Israel

title: Zelenskyy’s security in Washington being treated as 'mini-state visit,' sources say
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s visit to Washington is being treated as "mini state visit," sources said.

title: Congress to bestow medal to Emmett Till and his mother
description: The House has unanimously passed a bill posthumously awarding the Congressional Gold Medal to Emmett Till, the Chicago teenager murdered by white supremacists in the 1950s, and his mother, Mamie Till-Mobley

title: Ex-Harvard coach, dad acquitted in admissions bribery case
description: A former Harvard fencing coach was acquitted Wednesday of charges that he accepted more than $1.5 million in bribes in exchange for designating a wealthy businessman’s two sons as recruits to help secure their admission to the elite university

title: Coldest Christmas in decades possible for parts of US: What to expect Christmas Eve
description: Break out your hats and gloves -- this could be the coldest Christmas in decades for parts of the country.

title: New bridge to open in place of collapsed Pittsburgh span
description: Pennsylvania officials say a newly built bridge to replace the one that collapsed in Pittsburgh will open to traffic by the end of December

title: 8 girls, some just 13 years old, charged in Toronto fatal 'swarming' knife attack
description: Eight teenage girls are facing murder charges, accused of fatally stabbing a 59-year-old man in downtown Toronto in what police described as a "swarming" attack.

title: Charges dropped against ex-NFL wide receiver Antonio Brown
description: Former NFL wide receiver Antonio Brown will not face charges stemming from a domestic incident in Tampa, Florida

title: WHO 'very concerned' about reports of severe COVID in China
description: The head of the World Health Organization said the agency is “very concerned” about rising reports of severe coronavirus disease across China after the country largely abandoned its “zero COVID” policy

title: Russian hurdler stripped of 2012 Olympics gold for doping
description: Russian 400-meter hurdler Natalya Antyukh will lose her gold medal from the 2012 London Games because of doping

title: Sam Bankman-Fried agrees to extradition, clearing path for transport to US
description: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried is facing federal charges of fraud and conspiracy in the U.S.

title: Man gets parole after retrial conviction in 1995 killing
description: A New York man who was recently retried and convicted in a 1995 killing is set to get out of prison on parole as soon as next month

title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy in Washington live updates: Biden visit, address to Congress
description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is visiting Washington -- making his first trip outside Ukraine since the Russian invasion began in February.

title: Estranged kids of Canada condo gunman say he was abusive
description: Three estranged daughters of a 73-year-old man who fatally shot five people in his condominium near Toronto say he “was a controlling and abusive husband and father.”

title: Judge appointed Yankees captain after reaching longterm deal
description: Aaron Judge was appointed captain of the New York Yankees.

title: Scotland's move to simplify gender change stirs strong views
description: A plan by Scotland’s government to make it easier for people to change gender for legal purposes has sparked acrimonious debate both inside and outside of the Edinburgh parliament

title: WEB - LINK - BREAKING NEWS LIVE BLOG
Dead man found in wheel of jet flown from Gambia to England
description: Gambian authorities say that a dead man was found in the wheel bay of an airplane that flew from Gambia to Britain

title: Don't get 'so drunk' you need hospital during strike, UK health official says
description: Brits have been urged to “drink responsibly” during pre-Christmas celebrations to avoid hospital visits as thousands of ambulance workers strike.

title: Russia's defense minister calls for expanding military
description: Russia’s defense minister says the country’s military must be expanded from its current 1 million personnel to 1.5 million amid the fighting in Ukraine

title: Afghan women weep as Taliban fighters enforce university ban
description: Taliban security forces in Afghanistan's capital city are upholding a higher education ban for women by blocking access to university campuses

title: Steelers Hall of Fame running back Franco Harris dies at 72
description: Hall of Fame running back Franco Harris has died

title: Don't get drunk: UK govt urges caution amid ambulance strike
description: Thousands of ambulance workers in Britain are staging a 24-hour strike.

title: Video shows 11-year-old getting off bus before she went missing
description: Officials searching for missing 11-year-old Madalina Cojocari released a video showing the North Carolina girl getting off a school bus days before she was last seen.

title: On the holidays, efforts to distract Ukrainian kids from war
description: Ukrainian children have seen the horrors of a 10-month war.

title: Storm adds uncertainty to strong holiday travel demand
description: Concerns about inflation aren’t stopping Americans from hitting the road.

title: Women sexually abused by ICU nurse sue Colorado hospital
description: Two women say a nurse sexually assaulted them while they were unconscious.

title: WATCH:  'Christmas not canceled' in war-torn Bucha
description: ABC News' Britt Clennett is in Bucha, the scene of death and destruction amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, where our team saw a tree-lighting ceremony that is a symbol of Ukrainian resistance.

title: WATCH:  Train derails after colliding with tractor-trailer in Tennessee
description: Two crew members were transported to the hospital after a train collided with a tractor-trailer in Tennessee.

title: Man pleads guilty in Florida woman's unsolved 1991 slaying
description: A man already imprisoned in Florida for another killing has pleaded guilty to the unsolved 1991 slaying of a woman he met at a bar

title: Sam Bankman-Fried signs extradition papers, will return to US for charges
description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried has now signed extradition papers in the Bahamas, where he lived in a million-dollar mansion, after waffling on the decision one day prior.

title: Trump tax return-related documents to be released by congressional committee
description: Documents related to former President Donald Trump's tax returns will be released by the Democratic-controlled House Ways and Means Committee.

title: SC official says Alex Murdaugh will not face death penalty
description: State prosecutors will not seek the death penalty for Alex Murdaugh when the disbarred attorney appears in court next month for a double murder trial that has drawn international attention

title: Elon Musk says he'll resign as head of Twitter
description: "I will resign as CEO as soon as I find someone foolish enough to take the job!" Musk tweeted Tuesday.

title: DEA seized enough fentanyl to kill every American in 2022
description: The Drug Enforcement Administration on Tuesday said it has seized more than 379 million deadly doses of fentanyl this year.

title: Nazi symbol carved onto family's menorah in 'despicable' act
description: A man allegedly vandalized and carved a Nazi symbol into the base of a large menorah in Beverly Hills, California, on the first night of Hanukkah, according to police.
